results.title: Endangered
results.brief_description:
The following endangered species come to life from Australian stamps: Leadbeater’s Possum; Greater Bilby and the Stick Nest Rat. The film ends with a stamp depicting Australian Aboriginal, Truganini.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Flinder's Journey
results.brief_description:
This film comments on Matthew Flinders’ journey and personal experiences of new Australian states and his fascination with native life.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of Henry Handel Richardson
results.brief_description: This animated short was highly commended in the “Create a Stamp Story” section of the Screen It! competition. Henry Handel Richardson was the pseudonym of Ethel Florence Lyndsey Richardson; this stamp story is about her achievements in music and literature. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of Elizabeth Hayward
results.brief_description:
After stealing seven shilling’s worth of silk, Elizabeth Hayward gets sent to Australia in chains. She recounts, in a letter to her parents, her horrific journey and experience of malnutrition and violent treatment of convicts by white colonials and of her desire to be back home with her parents.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Unknown Island
results.brief_description:
Two Pacific explorers go sailing and encounter an unknown island. When they meet the tribal people and do not understand them, they procure a piece of land and build a dwelling.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Early Communication in Australia
results.brief_description: Challenged to create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer’, this highly commended work uses Australian stamps with historical and Aboriginal themes to narrate the methods and ways Australians have communicated over time. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Moments in Time
results.brief_description: In response to the challenge “Create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer’” these students came up with a highly entertaining magazine style ‘TV show’ featuring a story on an old lady and her memories of her family’s early days in Australia.An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Cultural Development of Australia
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the enrichening of Australian food and cuture through the immigration and culural exchange of other races and creeds.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
